author: A_Brickset_user
title: Creativity sparkler all the way!
review:
10/10. Wow! Now this really is a creativity sparkler. Motion Madness has a really nice mix of parts. Technic bricks with studs means that not half the set consists of the pins needed to click beams together like in the recent Technic series. As a consequence there's ample room (at this price point) for a slew of nice modelling parts like slanted bricks, antennas, wedges and wings. IMHO definately outclasses the current Technic series.

Other plusses: great colour scheme and topic flavour, very neat booklet with some nifty creations, and the cuteness factor.

Small minus: only detailed instructions for 6 of the 15 suggested creations are given. Especially the somewhat complicated lobster/scorpion? needed some kludging to get something resembling the pictures.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Why can't LEGO market their products properly?
review:
This is a FANTASTIC set, but I see it everywhere being sold in the clearance bins.

LEGO needs to do some marketing I think. Kids still love it, but they don't ask their parents for it because they always ask for whatever's being advertised on TV.

C'mon LEGO, do your part. Brag a little. Generate some excitement!

author: smiley905
title: works very well
review:
it has flapping wings and bobbing feet and lots of adjustable pieces. this set looks very good consitering all the gears inside it. theres lots of instructions for buidling things, my favorite is the coat hanger (it looks like a hat, but when wait is put on it, a face folds out!) this is a good set and e regret taking it a part :(
i would recomend it if you like that kind of thing

author: stitch
title: cool parts!
review: I got this set for christmas some years ago. It has alot of cool pieces you can use for robot and stuff like that. The only con is that some of them are hard to build and the ones that use robe are hard to find a place to tie. Example the bird can fly on the string but it is hard to fin a place to put the string.
